moves.1. e4: Ill have to admit that in this game I got a little lucky with an unusual mate
moves.2. f4 d5: Now i think were in the Sicilian gran prix attack
moves.3. exd5: He takes the pawn hoping to draw my queen in the center but I have other plans
moves.3... Nf6: I decide to gambit the pawn to take a lead in development
moves.4. Nc3: He develops his c knight and now I can take back the pawn safely.
moves.4... Nxd5 5. Nxd5 Qxd5: He exchanges knights to bring my queen out early
moves.6. Nf3 e6: There are ups and downs to this move I think.  Im developing my dsb but my lsb is blocked.
moves.8. Bxd7+: He did me a favor for eliminating my bad bishop
moves.8... Nxd7: Take back with the knight to develop this piece.
moves.9. O-O Bd6: developing my dsb with an eye toward h2
moves.10. d3 O-O 11. g3: He must really be worried about the pawn at f4
moves.11... e5: I put a little pressure on it
moves.12. fxe5 Nxe5: I take back with the knight because I want to save my bishop for the endgame.
moves.13. Nxe5 Bxe5: Now white has a hole on his kingside
moves.14. Qf3: To trade or not to trade?  I decide to trade because my endgame looks better than his.
moves.17. Bd2: Now he finally develops his bishop
moves.17... Rd7: Im planning to double my rooks on the d-file to win his d3 pawn
moves.18. Rd1 Rfd8 19. Be1: I thought he would move Bg5 attacking my rook anyhow he has successfully thwarted my double attack.
moves.21. d4 Bf6 22. Kf1: White is preparing for the endgame while getting his king towards the center.
moves.23. Re3: White attempts to take control of the e-file
moves.24. Rxe7 Bxe7: White is confident he can win this endgame.
moves.25. Be1: White tries to stop my queenside pawns from advancing
moves.25... Bd6: I dont understand why i made this move other than to attack whites kingside
moves.26. Bf2: White wants to skewer my pawn on a5 and rook on d8
moves.26... f5: I start my kingside advance since I have the pawn majority
moves.27. Be3: White tries to stop this with this move.
moves.29. Ke2: Whites king isnt going to let me promote those queenside pawns
moves.29... Re8: Now im trying to win the bishop with 30...f4 31.gxf4 Bf4
moves.30... Rc8: Trying to create a passed pawn on the c-file.
moves.31. Bf4: I decide not to trade down yet and move my bishop to cover the advancing white pawn on d4
moves.31... Be7 32. g4 fxg4+ 33. Kxg4: Further eroding his kingside as he moves towards the center of the board.
moves.33... c3 34. bxc3 bxc3: Now I have a passed pawn on the c-file but c1 is double defended
moves.35. Rf1 Kg8: I decide to protect my g pawn.
moves.36. Rc1: Hes obviously worried about my c pawn.
moves.36... Ba3: This was a blunder on my part as the attack  proves futile.
moves.37. Rc2 h6: Trying to develop my kingside pawn situation
moves.38. Be5: a good move by white indirectly attacking my c pawn twice.
moves.38... Rc4: Pinning his pawn to his king so he cannot make this manoveur.
moves.39. Kf5: He breaks the pin and now my cpawn is doomed.
moves.39... Kf7 40. d5: He advanced the pawn as expected but boy do I have a surprise for him
